div.p: The official URL for this implementation guide is:
FHIR Implementation Guide for Stroke: A Dual Focus on the Patient's Journey and Outcome Measures

description.value: FHIR Implementation Guide for Stroke: A Dual Focus on the Patient's Journey and Outcome Measures

valueMarkdown.value: Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on HL7 Terminology
Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on the HL7 Extension Pack

description.value: Indicate which comorbidities the patient is living with.
Indicate the patient’s level of consciousness measured on hospital arrival.
Indicate how the diagnosis was made.

name.value: Discharge Destination Following Acute Care Hospitalization

description.value: Indicate the patient’s discharge destination from acute care hospital.

name.value: Estimated Stroke Severity: based on NIHSS Category

description.value: Indicate the estimated stroke severity category by the NIH Stroke Scale (NIHSS).
Indicate if the patient underwent hemicraniectomy.
Indicate whether the person has ever been diagnosed with atrial fibrillation and flutter.
Indicate if the patient has a documented history of diabetes mellitus (regardless of duration of disease or need for anti-diabetic agents).
Indicate whether the patient has ever been diagnosed with hyperlipidemia.
Indicate whether the patient has a documented history of hypertension, diagnosed and treated with medication and/or diet and/or exercise.
Indicate whether the patient has ever been diagnosed with ischemic heart disease (including myocardial infarction).
Indicate whether the patient has a documented history of myocardial infarction.

name.value: Prior Stroke excluding Transient Ischemic Attacks

description.value: Indicate whether the patient was ever diagnosed with a stroke (excluding transient ischemic attacks).
Indicate whether the patient was ever diagnosed with a Transient Ischemic Attacks.
Indicate if the patient received procoagulant reversal therapy.
Indicate whether there is dedicated stroke rehabilitation during acute care.
Indicate whether there is dedicated stroke rehabilitation during post-acute care, either hospital based or out patient/home based.

name.value: Healthcare Facility based on the Brazilian RNDS

description.value: The Organization Profile encompasses all healthcare institutions related to stroke care, based on the Brazilian National Data Network (RNDS).

name.value: Stroke Patient based on the Brazilian RNDS

description.value: This profile stores demographics and other administrative information about a patient with stroke, based on the Brazilian National Data Network (RNDS).

name.value: Stroke Practitioner based on Brazilian RNDS

description.value: This profile encompasses all health professionals involved in the healthcare process and related health services as part of their formal responsibilities, conforming to the standards of the Brazilian National Data Network (RNDS).
Indicate if the patient had a new stroke within 90 days of their first stroke occurrence.
Indicate the stroke severity as measured by the NIH Stroke Scale (NIHSS). Report the raw (uncategorized) NIHSS score.
Indicate Stroke Type.
Indicate if the patient developed symptomatic intracerebral hemorrhage after treatment of ischemic stroke with intravenous thrombolysis and/or thrombectomy.
Indicate the duration of the stroke symptoms measured on hospital arrival.
Indicate if the patient underwent thrombectomy.
Indicate if the patient received intravenous thrombolytic therapy.
Extension to capture the patient's ethnicity which represents their cultural background or heritage.
Extension of the patient's gender.
Extension that represents the race of a patient.
Valueset that indicate which comorbidities the patient is living with. Select all conditions that apply.
ValueSet based on the ICHOM standard that indicates the patient's state of consciousness as measured upon arrival at the reference hospital.
ValueSet that indicates which diagnostic evidence base was used for its realization
ValueSet about discharge destination following acute care hospitalization. What type of place was the patient discharged to?

name.value: Estimated stroke severity using the NIHSS.

description.value: ValueSet that intended to categorize the severity of the stroke based on the National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS).
ValueSet for Gender Identity based on LOINC.
ValueSet indicating whether a patient lived alone prior to a stroke event based on ICHOM terminology.

name.value: Patient's Residence Post to a Stroke

description.value: ValueSet that represents the patient's most recent place of residence after the occurrence of a stroke based on ICHOM code.

name.value: Patient's Residence Prior to a Stroke

description.value: ValueSet that represents the patient's most recent place of residence before the occurrence of a stroke based on ICHOM code.
ValueSet with responses Yes, No, and Unknown
ValueSet that defines the response values for the PROMIS-10 (Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System 10-item short form) Questionnaire.
ValueSet that defines the response values for the simplified modified Ranking Scale questionnaire.
ValueSet for Smoking Status. A person's current and past smoking behavior.

name.value: Prestroke and Poststroke Functional Status: Ambulation

description.value: ValueSet that defines the response values for the Prestroke and Poststroke Functional Status: Ambulation.

name.value: Prestroke and Poststroke Functional Status: Dressing

description.value: ValueSet that defines the response values for the Prestroke and Poststroke Functional Status: Dressing.

name.value: Prestroke and Poststroke Functional Status: Toileting

description.value: ValueSet that defines the response values for the Prestroke and Poststroke Functional Status: Toileting.
ValueSet that aims to categorize the stroke type according to the ICHOM standard.
ValueSet that categorizes the duration of stroke symptoms, considering the time from symptom onset to admission at the reference hospital.
CodeSystem that indicate which comorbidities the patient is living with. Select all conditions that apply.

name.value: State of Consciousness according to the ICHOM standard

description.value: CodeSystem based on the ICHOM standard that indicates the patient's state of consciousness as measured upon arrival at the reference hospital.
CodeSystem that indicates which diagnostic evidence base was used for its realization
CodeSystem about Discharge destination following acute care hospitalization. What type of place was the patient discharged to?

name.value: Estimated stroke severity using the NIHSS.

description.value: CodeSystem that intends to categorize the severity of the stroke based on the National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS).
CodeSystem indicating whether a patient lived alone prior to a stroke event based on ICHOM terminology.

name.value: Patient's Residence Post to a Stroke

description.value: CodeSystem that represents the patient's most recent place of residence after the occurrence of a stroke based on ICHOM code.

name.value: Patient's Residence Prior to a Stroke

description.value: CodeSystem that represents the patient's most recent place of residence before the occurrence of a stroke based on ICHOM code.
CodeSystem that defines the response values for the PROMIS-10 (Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System 10-item short form) Questionnaire.
CodeSystem that defines the response values for the simplified modified Ranking Scale questionnaire (sMRSq).
CodeSystem for Smoking Status. A person's current and past smoking behavior.
CodeSystem that defines the response values for the Prestroke and Poststroke Functional Status.
CodeSystem that aims to categorize the stroke type according to the ICHOM standard.
CodeSystem that categorizes the duration of stroke symptoms, considering the time from symptom onset to admission at the reference hospital.
This questionnaire is meant to assess the clinical response in stroke patients at annual follow-up, from 1 year to 5 years post admission.
This questionnaire is meant to assess the clinical response in stroke patients at the initial point of assessment, which would be the first doctor's visit.

name.value: Clinical Response Questionnaire 02 - Discharge or 7 days post admission

description.value: This questionnaire is meant to assess the clinical response in stroke patients at the patient discharge or 7 days post admission, whichever comes first.

name.value: Clinical Response Questionnaire 03 - 90 days post admission

description.value: This questionnaire is meant to assess the clinical response in stroke patients at 90 days post admission.
Example of Cardiovascular Comorbidities. Indicate which comorbidities the patient is living with.
Example of Stroke Severity: Consciousness. Indicate the patient’s level of consciousness measured on hospital arrival.
Example of Diagnosis Evidence Base. Indicate how the diagnosis was made.

name.value: Discharge Destination Following Acute Care Hospitalization

description.value: Example of Discharge Destination Following Acute Care Hospitalization. Indicate the patient’s discharge destination from acute care hospital.

name.value: Estimated Stroke Severity: based on NIHSS Category

description.value: Example of Estimated Stroke Severity: based on NIHSS Category. Indicate the estimated stroke severity category by the NIH Stroke Scale (NIHSS).
Example of Hemicraniectomy. Indicate if the patient underwent hemicraniectomy.
Example of Prior Atrial Fibrillation and Flutter. Indicate whether the person has ever been diagnosed with atrial fibrillation and flutter.
Example of Prior Diabetes Mellitus. Indicate if the patient has a documented history of diabetes mellitus (regardless of duration of disease or need for anti-diabetic agents).
Example of Prior Hyperlipidemia. Indicate whether the patient has ever been diagnosed with hyperlipidemia.
Example of Prior Hypertension. Indicate whether the patient has a documented history of hypertension, diagnosed and treated with medication and/or diet and/or exercise.
Example of Prior Ischemic Heart Disease. Indicate whether the patient has ever been diagnosed with ischemic heart disease (including myocardial infarction).
Example of Prior Myocardial Infarction. Indicate whether the patient has a documented history of myocardial infarction.

name.value: Prior Stroke excluding Transient Ischemic Attacks

description.value: Example of Prior Stroke excluding Transient Ischemic Attacks. Indicate whether the patient was ever diagnosed with a stroke (excluding transient ischemic attacks).
Example of Prior Transient Ischemic Attacks. Indicate whether the patient was ever diagnosed with a Transient Ischemic Attacks.
Example of Procoagulant Reversal Therapy. Indicate if the patient received procoagulant reversal therapy.
Example of Inpatient Acute Care Rehabilitation. Indicate whether there is dedicated stroke rehabilitation during acute care.
Example of Post Acute Care Rehabilitation. Indicate whether there is dedicated stroke rehabilitation during post-acute care, either hospital based or out patient/home based.
Example of Stroke Recurrence. Indicate if the patient had a new stroke within 90 days of their first stroke occurrence.
Example of Stroke Severity: NIHSS Score. Indicate the stroke severity as measured by the NIH Stroke Scale (NIHSS). Report the raw (uncategorized) NIHSS score.
Example of Stroke Type. Indicate Stroke Type.

Example of Symptomatic Intracranial Hemorrhage. Indicate if the patient developed symptomatic intracerebral hemorrhage after treatment of ischemic stroke with intravenous thrombolysis and/or thrombectomy.
Example of Duration of Stroke Symptoms. Indicate the duration of the stroke symptoms measured on hospital arrival.
Example of Thrombectomy. Indicate if the patient underwent thrombectomy.
Example of Thrombolytic Therapy. Indicate if the patient received intravenous thrombolytic therapy.
This questionnaire is designed to assess the patient-reported response in stroke patients at the initial point of assessment.

name.value: Patient Reported Questionnaire 02 - Discharge or 7 days post admission

description.value: This questionnaire is designed to assess the patient-reported response in stroke at the patient discharge or 7 days post admission, whichever comes first.

name.value: Patient Reported Questionnaire 03 - 90 days post admission

description.value: This questionnaire is designed to assess the patient-reported response in stroke at 90 days post admission.
Example of Healthcare Facility related to stroke care, based on the Brazilian National Data Network (RNDS).
Example of Stroke Patient. This example presents a profile for stroke patient based on Brazilian RNDS.
This example presents a practitioner profile for stroke attendance based on Brazilian National Data Network.
